name: Lisa Johnson
background: Frontend performance engineer, obsessed with Core Web Vitals and speed
bias: Prioritizes speed and efficiency over fancy features or aesthetics
personality: Data-driven, impatient with bloat, measures everything
typical_concerns: Page load time (First Contentful Paint, Largest Contentful Paint)

bundle_size.description: Total JS < 200KB gzipped, no heavy dependencies, tree-shaking enabled

resource_optimization.description: Images optimized/WebP, lazy loading, efficient caching, CDN usage

runtime_performance.description: Smooth 60fps animations, no memory leaks, efficient re-renders

sample_feedback.positive: The app loads in under 2 seconds even on 3G. Bundle is well-optimized at 150KB. Images are lazy-loaded and served as WebP. Great caching strategy.
sample_feedback.negative: Bundle is 800KB - way too large! No lazy loading - everything loads upfront. Images are unoptimized PNGs. Takes 8 seconds to load on 4G. Janky scroll due to inefficient re-renders.
sample_feedback.suggestion: Use code splitting and lazy load routes. Replace Moment.js with date-fns (87% smaller). Compress and serve images as WebP. Implement virtual scrolling for long lists. Add proper caching headers.
